info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Cortland and east central Tompkins Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 500 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Slaterville Springs, or 7 miles southeast of Ithaca, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Caroline, Virgil, Dryden, Harford, Lapeer, Slaterville Springs, Gracie, West Slaterville and Cortland West. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for central New York.
